rutty.example: The boys walked down the dark rutty road.

pullets.definition: flesh of a medium-sized young chicken suitable for frying

bewilderingly.definition: in a bewildering and confusing manner
bewilderingly.example:
She was angry at
him, but she was also bewilderingly lonely, Aron hadn’t ever run away from her before.

pleadingly.example:
”
Faye spoke pleadingly, “Why don’t we go now?

rasped.example:
”
The dry earth was ticking under the sun and the crickets rasped.

coquetry.definition: playful behavior intended to arouse sexual interest
coquetry.example:
The men had their lodges, their clubs, their whorehouses; the women nothing but the
Altar Guild and the mincing coquetry of the minister until Dessie came along.

sharkskin.example:
The Liberty Belles could parade in white caps and uniforms of white
sharkskin.

geniality.definition: a disposition to be friendly and approachable (easy to talk to)
geniality.example:
”
Joe sensed a mild geniality in her and it made him feel good.

insatiably.example: He was a vicious male gossip, insatiably curious and vindictive without malice.

efface.definition: remove completely from recognition or memory
efface.example:
They seemed very small, and they tried
to efface themselves in outside neglect, and the wild over grown front yards tried to hide them
from the street.

doggedness.example:
We lost the flare of excitement and we had not
yet put on the doggedness of a long war.

bumbles.definition: make a mess of, destroy or ruin
bumbles.example:
The water bumbles over round stones and washes the polished roots of
the trees that hold it in.

shingling.definition: (geology) sediment in which flat pebbles are uniformly tilted in the same direction
shingling.example:
He heard horses’ hoofs plodding on the road and far-off pounding on wood where a neighbor was
shingling a barn.

hassocks.definition: thick cushion used as a seat
hassocks.example:
The hot cakes rose like little hassocks, and small
volcanos formed and erupted on them until they were ready to be turned.

parenthetically.example:
“She was a case,” and, parenthetically,
“You know Faye run Kate’s place.

disconsolately.definition: in grief-stricken loneliness; without comforting circumstances or prospects
disconsolately.example: Martin leaned on the handle of his brush and puffed disconsolately.

quirt.definition: whip with a leather thong at the end
quirt.example:
Edwards went to the town, took the
heavy quirt from his suitcase, and whipped the girls unmercifully; instead of seeing the thing his
way, the girls begged for more whipping to wipe out their fancied sins.

frogged.example:
He wore narrow cotton trousers, black heelless slippers, and a frogged
Chinese smock.
